node.title: China's COVID death rate is curiously low. An anonymous Beijing doctor told us how they’re doing it
node.alt: A young chinese woman in a face mask on a street bathed in fluorescent lights in Shanghai
node.description: Official figures suggest China may have become a global leader in keeping COVID-19 patients alive. But can the numbers be believed?
node.content:
["Chinese authorities have reported an extraordinary\u00a0COVID-19\u00a0feat: A death rate that is 62\u00a0times better than Australia's.\u00a0 \u00a0", "If accurate, the official figures\u00a0highlight the benefits of the world's strictest zero-tolerance policy,\u00a0which involved keeping borders closed and moving quickly to suppress small outbreaks.", "While many of its Asia-Pacific neighbours have given up on an elimination strategy, China continues to\u00a0keep its\u00a0borders mostly closed, with little prospect of them opening for another 12 months.\u00a0", "Some might question whether such an extraordinary figure can be trusted, but many experts told\u00a0the ABC\u00a0the extraordinarily low death rate is plausible.\u00a0", "One theory is that since the original outbreak in Wuhan was snuffed out,\u00a0the vast majority of cases in China have come from people arriving from overseas.", "People taking part in international travel are likely to be younger and healthier than those most at risk of severe disease.", "\"Case fatality rates vary greatly with age,\" explained Professor Ben Cowling, an infectious diseases expert at the University of Hong Kong.\u00a0", "\"If there were 1,000\u00a0cases with children or young adults, you wouldn't expect any deaths.\"\u00a0", "But imported cases from\u00a0travellers detected in hotel quarantine don't explain it all when it comes to China's startling success.", "
Early intervention or something 'intrinsically suspicious'?\u00a0
", "Over the past 18 months, there have been several localised clusters when cases from abroad have spread into Chinese cities.\u00a0", "Yet there have been almost no deaths recorded.", "", "
After a large outbreak in Wuhan in 2020, China's death rate from COVID-19 has continued to fall, according to official figures.\u00a0(China Daily via Reuters)
", "China is currently battling one of its biggest community outbreaks on multiple fronts, which has prompted snap restrictions on travel and the closure of some entertainment facilities.\u00a0", "As the latest outbreak grew in recent weeks, the death toll\u00a0from the National Health Commission\u00a0has remained unchanged at 4,636, despite hundreds of new cases circulating in multiple cities.\u00a0", "A pulmonary doctor at Beijing's Chaoyang hospital who did not\u00a0want to be named because he was not\u00a0authorised to speak to the media, told the ABC that compulsory COVID-19 testing and early detection of cases was likely the key factor in preventing deaths.\u00a0", "\"It means infections are detected at a very early stage and medical intervention begins quickly.\"\u00a0", "But other experts have questioned whether that would make such a dramatic\u00a0difference.\u00a0", "", "
Mass testing during small outbreaks in China may be keeping the death rate lower.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Mark Schiefelbein)
", "\"There isn't a specific treatment for SARS-COV-2, so picking it up for early intervention wouldn't completely explain the lack of deaths,\" said Dominic Dwyer, an infectious diseases specialist at Westmead Hospital who was part of the World Health Organization's investigation in Wuhan earlier this year.\u00a0", "\"There might be a number of factors, but I'd be intrinsically suspicious of any death rate that is 50 times lower than Australia.\"\u00a0", "
Delving into the official numbers\u00a0
", "Overall, from the very beginning of the outbreak, China's case fatality rate (CFR), which compares\u00a0the number of deaths to positive cases, is 4.4 per cent,\u00a0according to a tally from John Hopkins University in the US.", "That\u00a0is\u00a0far higher than Australia, which is\u00a0at 1 per cent, and the United States at 1.6 per cent.\u00a0", "But the number\u00a0masks the extraordinary turnaround in April last year, just as COVID-19 case numbers were soaring in other countries.\u00a0", "Nearly all of the recorded deaths on the Chinese government's tally occurred before April 17, 2020 \u2014 a day when China's National Health Commission revised the death toll up to account for earlier cases that had not initially\u00a0been included.\u00a0", "This was a period when China's suppression efforts successfully reduced domestic transmission down to negligible numbers after the virus claimed thousands of lives in Wuhan and the surrounding Hubei province.", "", "
China has maintained a strict zero-tolerance\u00a0policy since the outbreak began and shows no signs of changing tack to living with the virus.(Reuters:\u00a0Aly Song)
", "In the 18 months since, more than 14,886 cases of COVID-19 have been recorded in China\u00a0and only four people have died, according to the National Health Commission.\u00a0", "The figures don't\u00a0include the\u00a0more than 8,800\u00a0asymptomatic cases that\u00a0China's government does not\u00a0officially count.\u00a0", "If the figures are accurate, that means China has a case fatality ratio for the past 18 months of 0.016\u00a0per cent \u2014 12\u00a0times better than Singapore at 0.2 per cent and 62\u00a0times better than Australia's rate.", "In the same time period, other countries that initially locked out the virus with hotel quarantine and kept fatalities low, such as Australia, Taiwan and Singapore, have recorded hundreds of deaths each.", "The ABC contacted China's National Health Commission to ask how it had achieved such a remarkably low death rate but didn't get a response to questions.\u00a0", "
China's rapid response to outbreaks could be preventing deaths
", "The big difference for China has been community spread, according to\u00a0Professor Ben Cowling.\u00a0", "\"Once the virus gets into the community and starts spreading, that's when you start finding people getting very sick, getting into intensive care and even dying,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Due to the compulsory testing when there is an outbreak, the case numbers in China tend to include a lot of mild or asymptomatic infections that would never have been identified in other parts of the world.\"", "Detecting those mild cases, he argues, pushes up the total case numbers relative to deaths, resulting in a better case fatality rate.\u00a0", "The low death rate has\u00a0raised some questions about whether there might have\u00a0been COVID-related fatalities among\u00a0people with co-morbidities that were not\u00a0attributed to the virus.\u00a0", "", "
Dominic Dwyer said he's suspicious of any nation's death rate which appears to be 50 times lower than Australia's.\u00a0(ABC News: Bill Birtles)
", "\"Reporting on death certificates is always really tricky,\" said Professor Dwyer.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"Many of our patients at Westmead [Hospital in Sydney] are no longer infectious anymore, but they're in hospital for lung failure.", "\"If they're negative at the time of death, does it count as a COVID death?\"", "Over the past 18 months,\u00a0multiple local officials in China have been punished for overseeing small outbreaks in their areas, creating a disincentive to report cases.\u00a0", "The response to the initial outbreak in Wuhan was slowed down by a reluctance among local officials to report bad news up to national health authorities in Beijing.\u00a0", "Still, Yanzhong Huang, a senior fellow for global health at the US Council on Foreign Relations,\u00a0 thinks it is\u00a0unlikely that local health departments are fudging death certificates.\u00a0", "\"The government does have an incentive to paint a rosy picture of its pandemic efforts, but I think a deliberate cover-up of the cases is unlikely,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Some Chinese provinces and cities have started giving\u00a0boosters to people who received their first two shots at least six months ago.(Reuters:\u00a0Tingshu Wang)
", "\"They now have more than 80 per cent of the population fully vaccinated, so that would also factor in\u00a0the low death rate.\"\u00a0\u00a0", "Booster shots are now being rolled out in many parts of China for those who had their first two jabs six months ago or more.\u00a0\u00a0", "
The cost of China's apparent success
", "The Chinese Government's zero-tolerance policy to the virus appears to be hugely popular domestically.", "Some public suggestions of changing the strategy\u00a0to coexist\u00a0with the virus have been shot down in state media.\u00a0", "The\u00a0comparatively high death rates abroad have helped cement a widespread view that China's handling of the virus is superior to the outside world.", "There has been little public pushback against continuous border closures and quarantine periods of up to 21 days, even though the restrictions are unlikely to be relaxed anytime soon.\u00a0", "", "
Beijing is doubling\u00a0down on its elimination strategy, leaving borders closed until outbreaks are controlled.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Ng Han Guan)
", "A senior official has described the battle against COVID-19 as a choice between humans \"eliminating a virus or being swallowed by a virus.\"", "\"I think the messaging and\u00a0the propaganda in China has been so strong on the need for the strict measures,\"\u00a0said Professor Cowling.", "\"It will be difficult for them to change that\u00a0message when they do finally open up.\"\u00a0"]
